description: From be- +‎ stay, from Middle English *stayen, steyen, from Old French estaier, estayer (“to prop, stay, support”), from estaye (“prop, support”), of Proto-Germanic origin. More at stay.

verbs.description: bestay (third-person singular simple present bestays, present participle bestaying, simple past and past participle bestayed)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To secure or steady; cause to come to a fixed position or state; bring to a halt or stop.
examples: Mid the half-furrowed field bestay the plough, Bid the twin toilers of the yoke go free, And aught that doth thee patient servitude, From closing sabbath to its blest return, [...]
